intro: Chaetanthera dealbata, commonly known as the white-flowered moonflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, yellow berries that contain the seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique nocturnal blooming habit. The species is also noted for its fragrant scent, which attracts nocturnal pollinators such as moths.
